column4: hi kids. i`m currently running Ubuntu 8.10 with GNOME 2.24. I have downloaded the .iso file for GNOME 2.26 - is it possible to install it by burning the .iso onto a CD ?
do you mean you downloaded a GNOME ISO from the GNOME site?
yes
that'll be a love CD, and no you can't install it into Ubuntu
If you want GNOME 2.26 you'll need to upgrade your version of Ubuntu
I meant live CD! lol
what if i will download the source and compile it on my desktop ?
you could, but GNOME is an absolute bitch to compile
I wouldn't recommend it unless you'r einto masochism
hehehehe
jrib any advice on choosing another interface other than Gnome, KDE or XFCE. i have tried all but i couldnt find a suitable one from these 3
TWM!
OK, I;m kidding
jrib --- TWM = Tom's_Window_Manager ?
yes
It's the only WM a true geek should ever need
jrib ---> XFCE is TOO simple, KDE too complicated and i simply do not like GNOME :P. Will try TWM. Any other i should know about ?
If XFCE is too simple, then GNOME and KDE are your only choices really
Perhaps try Enlightenment e17 or LXDE/OpenBox (but that's simpler than Xfce)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlightenment_(window_manager)
!inkscape
jrib, mdm. thak you for your support
